FUNCTION_BLOCK RAMP_REAL
Limits the slope of a value to a certain value
The function block is similar to
RAMP_INT
with the difference that the inputs
IN
,
ASCEND
,
DESCEND
and the output
OUT
are of the type
REAL
.
RAMP_REAL
takes more computing time but calculates more precisely than
RAMP_INT
.
Note
A reset of the function block (
RESET
=
TRUE
) stops the calculation and the last output value
OUT
is maintained.
So if afterwards the ramp gets restarted by
RESET
=
FALSE
, it will start with this last output value!
